Detailed Description

Thread provides stack and context management

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

RODOS::Thread::Thread ( const char *  name = "AnonymThread",
const long  priority = DEFAULT_THREAD_PRIORITY,
const long  stackSize = DEFAULT_STACKSIZE 
)

Initialization of the thread. A user should use a meaningful name for the thread.

Parameters:
nameName of the thread.
priorityThe priority for the thread. Only the thread with the highest value from several runnable threads at a time get computing resources.
stackSizeThe size of the stack memory for the thread. Choice a matching value for the task of the thread.
See also:
DEFAULT_THREAD_PRIORITY
DEFAULT_STACKSIZE

Destructor.

static Thread* RODOS::Thread::findNextToRun ( TTime  timeNow) [static]

Search over all threads and select the one with the highest priority which is ready to run

Returns:
The pointer to the highest priorized runnable thread.
See also:
resume
static Thread* RODOS::Thread::findNextWaitingFor ( void *  signaler) [static]

Search over all threads and select the one with the highest priority which is not ready to run and waiting for the given signaler.

Parameters:
signalerPointer to the signaler where the thread has to wait on.
Returns:
Pointer to the highest priorized thread waiting on the signaler.
static Thread* RODOS::Thread::getCurrentThread ( ) [static]

Get a pointer to the currently running thread. The method can used to identify the calling thread in classes with no inheritance to the class Thread.

Returns:
Pointer to the currently running thread.

Referenced by RODOS::SyncFifo< Type, len >::syncGet(), and RODOS::SyncFifo< Type, len >::syncPut().

Returns:
The priority of the thread.
static unsigned long long RODOS::Thread::getScheduleCounter ( ) [static]

Get the schedule counter.

Returns:
The current schedule counter. The counter is increased for each schedule operation.
virtual void RODOS::Thread::init ( void  ) [inline, virtual]

The method is called after all constructors are executed and before the threads are activated by a call to the method run.

It should be overloaded in case the thread has to call other objects for the initialization, hence after all instances are present and before any run method is invoked.

See also:
run

Definition at line 144 of file thread.h.

static void RODOS::Thread::initializeThreads ( ) [static, private]

call the init method of all threads

void RODOS::Thread::resume ( )

Resume the thread. The tread get after the call to the method computing resources if no other thread with a higher priority occupy the resources. It end calls to the methods suspendCallerUntil and suspendUntilNextBeat.

See also:
suspendCallerUntil
suspendUntilNextBeat
Semaphore

Referenced by RODOS::SyncFifo< Type, len >::putGeneric(), resumeAndYield(), RODOS::SyncFifo< Type, len >::syncGet(), and RODOS::SyncFifo< Type, len >::syncPut().

void RODOS::Thread::resumeAndYield ( ) [inline]

like resume, but if the resumed thread has a higher piroirty than the runing one then a task switch will take place at oncce.

WARNING: NEVER call it from an interrupt server

virtual void RODOS::Thread::run ( ) [pure virtual]

Entry point for user code. The thread activities shall implement by overloading this method.

Implemented in RODOS::Gateway, and RODOS::TopicReporter.

void RODOS::Thread::setPeriodicBeat ( const TTime  begin,
const TTime  period 
)

Defines the start of computing periods for the method suspendUntilNextBeat.

Parameters:
beginTime for first the start time of the first computing period.
periodPeriod between the start time of computing periods.
See also:

static bool RODOS::Thread::suspendCallerUntil ( const TTime  reactivationTime = END_OF_TIME,
void *  signaler = 0 
) [static]

Suspend the thread until a given time or a wake up by a call to the method resume. By the optional pointer to a signaler the thread could be woken up. A signal is for example an object of type inherited from class Event.

Parameters:
[in]reactivationTimeOptional time to wake up. Default value is end of time.
[in]signalerPointer to signaler, which can resume the thread.
Returns:
True if the thread is resumed, false if the reactivation time is reached.
See also:
resume
Event

Referenced by RODOS::SyncFifo< Type, len >::syncGet(), and RODOS::SyncFifo< Type, len >::syncPut().

void RODOS::Thread::suspendUntilNextBeat ( )

Suspend a thread until the next computing period of the thread start. The computing periods are computed from a start and a periodical time set with the method setPeriodicBeat. The thread is suspend for ever if setPeriodicBeat isn't called before a call to this method.

A call to method resume by another thread or an subscribed event or topic can wake up the thread before the next computing period starts. In this cases the reason shall checked by the thread after wake up.

See also:
setPeriodicBeat
resume
Subscriber
static void RODOS::Thread::yield ( ) [static]

Cause the currently running thread to pause and perform a reschedule.

Referenced by resumeAndYield().
